thread.title: 2017 Preseason - Sunday, February 19: A friendly pairing
thread.title_full: 2017 Preseason - Sunday, February 19: A friendly pairing

title: 2017 Preseason - Sunday, February 19: A friendly pairing

organizations.name: orlando city sc vs. toronto fc

text:
The Sunday slate features a couple of signature friendlies, with some scrimmage action along the way. here's the rundown: FC Dallas vs. SMU (Scrimmage) 
A little early-morning action in Frisco, Texas, where local side FC Dallas hosted the SMU Mustangs men's soccer team for a scrimmage. The report via @FCDallas Twitter is a 2-0 victory for the MLSers, with both goals coming from Paxton Pomykal . 
The Homegrown Player linked up with Adonijah Reid on the first , and another from outside the box in the 81st. Two goals including this sweet strike. Not a bad Sunday morning for Homegrown @PaxiPomy ! pic.twitter.com/weYCMpcp3K — FC Dallas (@FCDallas) February 19, 2017 
The MLS club rolled out a starting XI of: Jesse Gonzalez; Trialist, Aaron Guillen, Walker Hume, Reggie Cannon; Anibal Chala, Jacori Hayes, Carlos Cermeño, Rosales; Adonijah Reid, Paxton Pomykal. 1' > We're underway on a foggy morning in Frisco against @SMUSoccerM ! pic.twitter.com/crsFP8zjNL — FC Dallas (@FCDallas) February 19, 2017 Orlando City SC vs. Toronto FC 
The two MLS squads square off in a pair of back-to-back matches starting at 2pm ET. Check out their respective Twitter feeds ( @OrlandoCitySC | TOR: @Toronto FC ) to stay on top of the action. It’s a preseason matchday. — Toronto FC (@torontofc) February 19, 2017 Chicago Fire vs. Miami FC (NASL) 
Tonight at 6 p.m. ET, the Men in Red take on NASL side Miami FC at the IMG Academy in Bradenton, Florida. They've got a full preview worked up on the club site, and you can WATCH LIVE via YouTube. — Chicago Fire (@ChicagoFire) February 18, 2017 
For their part, Miami FC brought supporters in behind-the-scenes with a preseason photo gallery of the week's action.
